DOCNAME: CASE OF PEPSZOLG KFT ("v.a.") v. HUNGARY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a limited liability company , founded in DATE , with its seat in GPE . It is currently in the process of being wound up .

CARDINAL . In DATE an action was brought against the applicant company by an entity called ORG which claimed to be the successor of ORG , CARDINAL of the applicant company ’s shareholders . The plaintiff sought inter alia the invalidation of the registration of the applicant company , claiming that ORG were against the law .

CARDINAL . NORP In its final decision of CARDINAL DATE , ORG held that ORG had been in force until DATE of its decision , but were void thereafter . It ordered the winding - up of the applicant company .

CARDINAL . Consequently , on DATE ORG ordered the representative of the applicant company to submit the name , address and authorisation of a liquidation manager ( végelszámoló ) . Despite the representative ’s failure to comply with this order , on DATE ORG declared the applicant company ’s dissolution as of CARDINAL DATE , and registered the fact that it was in the process of winding - up .

CARDINAL . On appeal , on DATE ORG , sitting as a second - instance court , quashed this decision and remitted the case to ORG , holding that it had delivered its decision despite the representative ’s failure to provide the requisite information .

CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG appointed a liquidation manager and declared the retroactive dissolution of the applicant company , as of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE it ordered that corresponding entries be made in the companies register . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of DATE . A further appeal was dismissed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE , the respective liquidation managers were consecutively replaced .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , in reaction to various appeals and requests for supplementation or rectification , amendments were made to the order of CARDINAL DATE on DATE , and CARDINAL and CARDINAL September CARDINAL . On DATE the judges of ORG declared themselves biased . Subsequently , ORG was appointed to deal with the case . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively , this court ordered that the decisions of CARDINAL DATE and DATE be amended . On DATE ORG , sitting as a second - instance court , dismissed the applicant company ’s appeal filed against a procedural order of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG of ORG initiated execution proceedings against the applicant company .
CARDINAL . The winding - up proceedings are still pending .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant company instituted proceedings against several defendants , claiming damages in the amount of MONEY , plus accrued interest ( “ the DATE proceedings ” ) .

CARDINAL . NORP Moreover , on DATE the applicant company brought an action in trespass and for restitutio in integrum of a real property against ORG ( “ the DATE proceedings ” ) . On DATE the GPE XX / XXI District Court transferred this case to the competent ORG . On DATE the plaintiff completed its action .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the proceedings pending the establishment of the validity of the applicant company ’s ORG ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL above ) . In DATE the applicant company requested the continuation of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG continued the proceedings and invited the applicant company to complete its action . It gave better particulars of its claims on DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG held hearings on DATE , CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL May , DATE and DATE . On DATE it requested a further supplementation of the applicant company ’s claims . The latter complied with the order on DATE . On DATE an expert engineer was appointed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court , upon the parties’ request , stayed the proceedings . On DATE the proceedings resumed . Further hearings took place on DATE , DATE and DATE , DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted a motion for bias against ORG . ORG rejected the motion on DATE . On DATE the winding - up manager submitted a motion for bias against the presiding judge which was rejected on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE and the DATE proceedings were joined . On DATE ORG held a hearing and again invited the applicant company to complete its claim , which it did on DATE . On DATE and DATE , respectively , CARDINAL further motions of the applicant company for bias were rejected .

CARDINAL . After a hearing on DATE , on DATE ORG delivered a partial decision . On DATE ORG confirmed this decision . The applicant company lodged a petition for review with ORG . On DATE ORG dismissed its petition .
CARDINAL . Meanwhile , in DATE the applicant company instituted another set of proceedings against ORG . , the successor of the respondent in the DATE proceedings ( “ the DATE proceedings ” ) .

On DATE and CARDINAL DATE , the court held hearings . At the latter date , it invited the parties to submit preparatory documents . They complied with the order on DATE and DATE , respectively . On DATE , and DATE and DATE , the court held further hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , the court appointed technical experts who submitted their opinions on DATE and DATE , respectively .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE another hearing took place and the proceedings were suspended . On DATE the applicant company requested the court to continue the proceedings . On DATE the court held a hearing and again suspended the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company lodged a motion for bias against the court which was dismissed by ORG on DATE . In DATE these proceedings were joined to the DATE and DATE proceedings .
CARDINAL . The proceedings concerning the remainder of the joined DATE cases are still pending at first instance .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE PERSON . filed a motion for the protection of possessions with GPE . On DATE the motion was rejected . Subsequently , on DATE the complainant brought an action in trespass against ORG , which claimed to be the successor of the applicant company , and other defendants , including the applicant company itself .

CARDINAL . In its order of CARDINAL DATE , ORG stated that the applicant company had been dissolved and had therefore no capacity to conduct legal proceedings . It requested the plaintiff to provide the court with the name of the applicant company ’s liquidation manager .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed ORG that ORG was not a registered company .
CARDINAL . The case was then transferred to ORG and , on DATE , to ORG . On DATE ORG held that the GPE XX / XXI / XXIII ORG was competent to hear the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the plaintiff to specify its claims . On DATE the plaintiff requested the extension of the time - limit and on DATE it complied with ORG order . On DATE the respondents submitted their counter - claims .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the defendants to clarify the relation between the applicant company and ORG In reply , the court was informed that the applicant company “ had changed its name to ORG ” on CARDINAL DATE ; however , the changes had not been registered by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings against ORG , but not against the applicant company , whose winding - up was in progress . Subsequently , extensive correspondence developed between the parties and the court concerning the service of this decision and the capacity of the applicant company and ORG to conduct legal proceedings . In the course of these events , the applicant company repeatedly submitted to the court that the CARDINAL entities were CARDINAL and the same , but in vain .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , ORG suspended the proceedings until the termination of the proceedings described in chapter “ A ” above . On DATE the defendants complained of this decision . On DATE ORG dismissed their complaint . On appeal , ORG , acting as a second - instance court , quashed the first - instance decision and ordered ORG to continue the proceedings .

CARDINAL . Ultimately , the decision of CARDINAL DATE became final . On DATE ORG again suspended the proceedings until the termination of the case outlined in chapter “ A ” above . The defendants appealed . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal . The proceedings have been pending ever since .

CARDINAL . On either DATE or DATE , PERSON . brought another action in trespass against ORG , in the context of a challenge to a decision by the GPE given on DATE . Again , extensive correspondence developed between the court and the parties as to ORG locus standi .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG invited the plaintiff to submit documents . In its submissions of DATE , the plaintiff requested the suspension of the proceedings . On DATE ORG refused the request .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the Budapest XX / XXI / XXIII ORG transferred the case to ORG . On DATE ORG held a hearing and , at the parties’ request , stayed the proceedings . On CARDINAL DATE the plaintiff requested the continuation of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Pest Central District Court forwarded the case file to ORG for appropriate delegation . On DATE ORG appointed the GPE XX / XXI / XXIII ORG to hear the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings , holding that ORG was not a registered legal entity . On DATE the court confirmed that this decision had become final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company ’s liquidation manager requested the continuation of the proceedings . On DATE ORG dismissed the request . On DATE the applicant company complained of this decision . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint . On DATE the applicant company appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected ORG appeal , introduced after the actual service of the first instance decision , as being inadmissible ratione personae .
CARDINAL . On appeal , on DATE ORG ordered the resumption of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the plaintiff eventually withdrew its action .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , a shareholder of the applicant company ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , brought an action against the latter , challenging a ORG resolution . Subsequently , a manager employed by the plaintiff withdrew the action , and the proceedings were discontinued on CARDINAL DATE . This decision was not served on the applicant company .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company requested proper service of the decision . On DATE ORG observed that the manager in question had not been entitled to act on behalf of the plaintiff , which in any case had ceased to exist in DATE . Consequently , the proceedings had to be declared as having been interrupted ( félbeszakadt ) as of DATE .

DATE . On DATE the applicant company requested ORG to proceed with the case , in order to obtain a proper order to discontinue and finally terminate the interrupted proceedings . On DATE ORG dismissed the request . The applicant company ’s appeal was to no avail .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE the ORG submitted a motion for bias against ORG , which was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG finally discontinued the proceedings .
